availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harris Keeney (Switzerland County, Indiana, blacksmith and soldier)

body.p: Switzerland County, Indiana, blacksmith and soldier. New York native. Married to Charlotte L. Keeney. Father of John G. Keeney, Job M. Keeney, Charles H. Keeney, and Edwin H. Keeney. Blacksmith in Switzerland County, Indiana in 1850. Postmaster in Switzerland County in 1853. Blacksmith in Switzerland County in 1860. Served in the 54th Indiana Infantry as first lieutenant from June 10, 1862 to September 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Switzerland County, Posey, p. 439A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Switzerland County, Jefferson, p. 313.
Find A Grave, "Col Harris Keeney (Apr 20, 1818-Jan 15, 1872)," Memorial #121786743, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/121786743 (accessed April 25, 2020).
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, Indiana (Randolph-Whitley), Vol. #14, p. 291 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #363102, Certificate #306143.
"Kenney, Harris,"Soldier Details https://www.nps.gov.
